content:
Are there existing proofs anywhere for roundtripping properties such as 

theorem stringToIntRoundtrip (x: Int) : (String.toInt? (toString x)) = some x := by sorry

I can't find any on moogle or the core lean4 codebase

Relatedly; is there a String.toFloat?
Not that I know of. There were some theorems about the Lean 3 parser that didn't survive the transition to Lean 4.
I'm mostly curious where such proofs would come up.

I was hoping to do so to prove that my implementation of RDF Literals in lean round-tripped. In most other languages you would be testing the correctness of implementation by writing unit tests like this.

I'm able to write such round trip proofs for other literals such as https://github.com/jeswr/RDF.lean/blob/7fa2cd50447f8343fcaea8bca8cae4d12d116786/RDF/Literal.lean#L87-L101
Nice, this is a great application. Unfortunately it looks like you'll have to fill in these basics yourself.
